result.execSummary:
The defendant Brock Alexander Katcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brock Alexander Katcher

records.addlTxt:
Received phone call from Mr. Katcher, stating he has paid his financial obligations, made payment to the State.  He was advised that the Clerk of Court's office has not received any payment.  His probation agent Matthew Teachout then called the Clerk of Court's office asking if we had received any money from DOC- he stated he will inquire as to where the payment is (he understands that it should be sent to Clerk of Court.)
Probation agent also stated that the DOC does not suggest expunction to the Court, as the DE did violate terms of probation and received an extension of probation.
DISCHARGE - REGULAR

Defendant paid $352 directly to the Clerk of Court in 2017 through e-payments.  DOC shows balance of $1016 owing, minus $352 equals total owed $664.00.
Judgment entered for this amount.
Order on Petition for civil judgment for court ordered financial obligations
DEFENDANT'S DOC BALANCE INQUIRY
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
Cover LETC from DOC Agent requesting the Court to convert DE's unpaid court obligations to a civil judgment.

2:49 PM   Defendant Brock Alexander Katcher not in court.   Probation agent Matthew Teachout appears by phone.
Court sets the record, DOC filed a petition for a court order converting Defendant's unpaid financial obligations after completion of probation to a civil judgment.  Court inquires about the payment history of the Defendant and his efforts to pay the obligations.  Agent makes statement regarding the RE having made only one $20 payment 9-11-2020, states the RE claims he has been unable to work as a server due to Covid. 
Probation agent states other counties he has worked with generally convert cases such as this to civil judgment. Court accepts the statement of the probation agent and requests he submit another proposed Order to the court.
Probation review hearing on October 12, 2020 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Brock Alexander Katcher in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant Acknowledges receipt of information, waives right to pre-lim. Court finds: Def waives right to preliminary hearing. PC found. DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Def pleads guilty to Counts 3 & 4. Court accepts plea, finds def guilty of counts 3 & 4. Counts 1, 2 & 5 DRI. 
 Court dismisses and reads-in Barron county case 16CF45. Forfeit any and all proceedings in case # 16CV17
State argues sentence. DEF argues sentence, joint recommendation. Def addresses court.
Court withholds sentence Counts 3 & 4, imposes 3 years probation, may be transferred to another county, with no cost to Sawyer; 6 months conditional jail time, 3 months imposed, 3 months stayed, credit for 71 days time served; complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; 100 hrs community service; court costs of   $1036.00     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Report to jail 1/6/17 by 3:00 PM. Time may be served in another county if no cost to Sawyer County. Court allows Def to petition for expungment upon successful completion of probation.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today. Def to report to Jail for DNA today. No firearms or voting priviledges while serving sentence.
